title: "if..." movie logo
content:
Can anyone identify the font used in the logo of the movie “if....”? I don’t have a better sample, unfortunately. I tried attaching it, but it wouldn’t let me, so, I’ve inserted it in the post, instead.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111204536im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ifposter.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Brian Aldiss "A Science Fiction Omnibus" cover [2007 ed.] - ITC Avant Garde Gothic {Florian}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111204536/http:/typophile.com/node/40436 "Go to previous forum topic") [Bedroom Furniture Galleries logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111204536/http:/typophile.com/node/40427 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tartarus

comments.content: looks a lot like [ITC Tiffany Heavy](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111204536/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/tiffany/medium-heavy/), but not exactly the same.
It does look sort of like this or that, but I don’t see any matches. I think it could be custom drawn, given the time it’s from. It’s only two letters, after all.

perhaps it’s squooshed Tiffany?

[edit] with a numeral 1 instead of the body of the lc i?

The reason I don’t think it’s based on Tiffany is the square ends on the serifs. Tiffany has round ends on the serifs. Otherwise, I agree there is some similarity. The top of the f is very similar to Poster Bodoni (a.k.a. Ultra Bodoni), but the bracketed serifs and the top of the i are very not Bodoni. It also has some similarity to very bold Caslons, but the top of the f is not like Caslon at all.

\> looks a lot like ITC Tiffany Heavy, but not exactly the same.

I remember seeing a “more fonts like this” option link at Myfonts, but when you click on that for the Tiffany family, \*you would not believe\* the mish-mash that is brought up, including graffiti fonts.  
So much for that bright idea.  
: )

<cite>The reason I don’t think it’s based on Tiffany is the square ends on the serifs. Tiffany has round ends on the serifs. Otherwise, I agree there is some similarity.</cite>

i noticed that too, but unless he’s looking for the exact precise match (which might not exist), Tiffany is a pretty good alternative.

by the way, here’s a somewhat better look at it, where you clearly see that the serifs are square unlike Tiffany.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111204536im_/http:/typophile.com/files/if-poster.jpg)
Naw, straight top of the i and unbracketed serifs.
